meanings.definition: To give a handsel to; to use or apply for the first time; to christen with a new name.
meanings.sent1: She handselled the boat by painting its name on the side for the first time.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic handselled the newly built engine by starting it up for the first time.
meanings.sent3: The artist handselled her masterpiece by signing it with her new pseudonym.
meanings.sent4: The chef handselled the dish with a sprinkle of his secret seasoning.
meanings.sent5: The teacher handselled the student's essay with a gold star for excellence.

meanings.definition: To inaugurate or launch something new or innovative.
meanings.sent1: The company handselled their latest product with a grand unveiling event.
meanings.sent2: The museum handselled the exhibit with a ribbon-cutting ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The team handselled their winning streak with a celebratory dance.
meanings.sent4: The author handselled her new book with a book signing tour.
meanings.sent5: The city handselled the new park with a fireworks display.
